interfaces.network.factoryÂ¶

Source: src\interfaces\network\factory.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Network interface factory for creating communication interfaces. This module provides factory methods and utilities for creating and configuring various types of network communication interfaces for control systems applications.

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#========================= src/interfaces/network/factory.py ==========================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Network interface factory for creating communication interfaces.
  7This module provides factory methods and utilities for creating and
  8configuring various types of network communication interfaces for
  9control systems applications.
 10"""
 11
 12from typing import Dict, Any, Type, Optional, Union
 13import logging
 14
 15from ..core.protocols import CommunicationProtocol
 16from ..core.data_types import InterfaceConfig, InterfaceType
 17
 18from .udp_interface import UDPInterface, UDPServer, UDPClient
 19from .tcp_interface import TCPInterface, TCPServer, TCPClient
 20from .http_interface import HTTPInterface, HTTPServer, HTTPClient
 21from .websocket_interface import WebSocketInterface, WebSocketServer, WebSocketClient
 22from .message_queue import MessageQueueInterface, ZeroMQInterface, RabbitMQInterface
 23
 24
 25class NetworkInterfaceFactory:
 26    """
 27    Factory for creating network communication interfaces.
 28
 29    This factory provides centralized creation and configuration of
 30    various network interface types with consistent configuration
 31    patterns and error handling.
 32    """
 33
 34    # Registry of available interface types
 35    _interface_registry: Dict[str, Type[CommunicationProtocol]] = {
 36        # UDP interfaces
 37        'udp': UDPInterface,
 38        'udp_server': UDPServer,
 39        'udp_client': UDPClient,
 40
 41        # TCP interfaces
 42        'tcp': TCPInterface,
 43        'tcp_server': TCPServer,
 44        'tcp_client': TCPClient,
 45
 46        # HTTP interfaces
 47        'http': HTTPInterface,
 48        'http_server': HTTPServer,
 49        'http_client': HTTPClient,
 50
 51        # WebSocket interfaces
 52        'websocket': WebSocketInterface,
 53        'ws_server': WebSocketServer,
 54        'ws_client': WebSocketClient,
 55
 56        # Message queue interfaces
 57        'zeromq': ZeroMQInterface,
 58        'rabbitmq': RabbitMQInterface,
 59    }
 60
 61    # Default configurations for interface types
 62    _default_configs: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]] = {
 63        'udp': {
 64            'endpoint': 'localhost:8080',
 65            'use_crc': True,
 66            'use_sequence': True,
 67            'buffer_size': 4096,
 68        },
 69        'tcp': {
 70            'endpoint': 'localhost:8080',
 71            'auto_reconnect': True,
 72            'reconnect_delay': 5.0,
 73            'max_message_size': 1024 * 1024,
 74        },
 75        'http': {
 76            'endpoint': 'localhost:8080',
 77            'enable_cors': True,
 78            'timeout': 30.0,
 79        },
 80        'websocket': {
 81            'endpoint': 'localhost:8080',
 82            'heartbeat_interval': 30.0,
 83        },
 84        'zeromq': {
 85            'sockets': [
 86                {
 87                    'name': 'pub',
 88                    'type': 'pub',
 89                    'endpoint': 'tcp://localhost:5555',
 90                    'bind': True
 91                }
 92            ]
 93        },
 94        'rabbitmq': {
 95            'url': 'amqp://guest:guest@localhost/',
 96        }
 97    }
 98
 99    @classmethod
100    def create_interface(
101        cls,
102        interface_type: str,
103        name: str = "default",
104        config_overrides: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None
105    ) -> CommunicationProtocol:
106        """
107        Create network interface of specified type.
108
109        Parameters
110        ----------
111        interface_type : str
112            Type of interface to create (e.g., 'udp', 'tcp_server', 'websocket')
113        name : str
114            Name for the interface instance
115        config_overrides : Dict[str, Any], optional
116            Configuration overrides for the interface
117
118        Returns
119        -------
120        CommunicationProtocol
121            Configured network interface instance
122
123        Raises
124        ------
125        ValueError
126            If interface type is not supported
127        """
128        if interface_type not in cls._interface_registry:
129            available_types = list(cls._interface_registry.keys())
130            raise ValueError(
131                f"Unsupported interface type: {interface_type}. "
132                f"Available types: {available_types}"
133            )
134
135        # Get interface class
136        interface_class = cls._interface_registry[interface_type]
137
138        # Build configuration
139        config = cls._build_interface_config(
140            interface_type, name, config_overrides
141        )
142
143        # Create and return interface instance
144        try:
145            return interface_class(config)
146        except Exception as e:
147            logging.error(f"Failed to create {interface_type} interface: {e}")
148            raise
149
150    @classmethod
151    def create_udp_interface(
152        cls,
153        host: str = "localhost",
154        port: int = 8080,
155        server_mode: bool = False,
156        **kwargs
157    ) -> Union[UDPInterface, UDPServer, UDPClient]:
158        """
159        Create UDP interface with simplified configuration.
160
161        Parameters
162        ----------
163        host : str
164            Host address
165        port : int
166            Port number
167        server_mode : bool
168            Whether to create server or client interface
169        **kwargs
170            Additional configuration options
171
172        Returns
173        -------
174        UDPInterface
175            Configured UDP interface
176        """
177        interface_type = 'udp_server' if server_mode else 'udp_client'
178        config_overrides = {
179            'endpoint': f"{host}:{port}",
180            **kwargs
181        }
182        return cls.create_interface(interface_type, config_overrides=config_overrides)
183
184    @classmethod
185    def create_tcp_interface(
186        cls,
187        host: str = "localhost",
188        port: int = 8080,
189        server_mode: bool = False,
190        **kwargs
191    ) -> Union[TCPInterface, TCPServer, TCPClient]:
192        """
193        Create TCP interface with simplified configuration.
194
195        Parameters
196        ----------
197        host : str
198            Host address
199        port : int
200            Port number
201        server_mode : bool
202            Whether to create server or client interface
203        **kwargs
204            Additional configuration options
205
206        Returns
207        -------
208        TCPInterface
209            Configured TCP interface
210        """
211        interface_type = 'tcp_server' if server_mode else 'tcp_client'
212        config_overrides = {
213            'endpoint': f"{host}:{port}",
214            **kwargs
215        }
216        return cls.create_interface(interface_type, config_overrides=config_overrides)
217
218    @classmethod
219    def create_http_interface(
220        cls,
221        host: str = "localhost",
222        port: int = 8080,
223        server_mode: bool = False,
224        **kwargs
225    ) -> Union[HTTPInterface, HTTPServer, HTTPClient]:
226        """
227        Create HTTP interface with simplified configuration.
228
229        Parameters
230        ----------
231        host : str
232            Host address
233        port : int
234            Port number
235        server_mode : bool
236            Whether to create server or client interface
237        **kwargs
238            Additional configuration options
239
240        Returns
241        -------
242        HTTPInterface
243            Configured HTTP interface
244        """
245        interface_type = 'http_server' if server_mode else 'http_client'
246        config_overrides = {
247            'endpoint': f"http://{host}:{port}",
248            **kwargs
249        }
250        return cls.create_interface(interface_type, config_overrides=config_overrides)
251
252    @classmethod
253    def create_websocket_interface(
254        cls,
255        host: str = "localhost",
256        port: int = 8080,
257        server_mode: bool = False,
258        **kwargs
259    ) -> Union[WebSocketInterface, WebSocketServer, WebSocketClient]:
260        """
261        Create WebSocket interface with simplified configuration.
262
263        Parameters
264        ----------
265        host : str
266            Host address
267        port : int
268            Port number
269        server_mode : bool
270            Whether to create server or client interface
271        **kwargs
272            Additional configuration options
273
274        Returns
275        -------
276        WebSocketInterface
277            Configured WebSocket interface
278        """
279        interface_type = 'ws_server' if server_mode else 'ws_client'
280        config_overrides = {
281            'endpoint': f"ws://{host}:{port}",
282            **kwargs
283        }
284        return cls.create_interface(interface_type, config_overrides=config_overrides)
285
286    @classmethod
287    def create_zeromq_interface(
288        cls,
289        socket_configs: Optional[list] = None,
290        **kwargs
291    ) -> ZeroMQInterface:
292        """
293        Create ZeroMQ interface with socket configuration.
294
295        Parameters
296        ----------
297        socket_configs : list, optional
298            List of socket configurations
299        **kwargs
300            Additional configuration options
301
302        Returns
303        -------
304        ZeroMQInterface
305            Configured ZeroMQ interface
306        """
307        config_overrides = kwargs.copy()
308        if socket_configs:
309            config_overrides['sockets'] = socket_configs
310
311        return cls.create_interface('zeromq', config_overrides=config_overrides)
312
313    @classmethod
314    def create_rabbitmq_interface(
315        cls,
316        url: str = "amqp://guest:guest@localhost/",
317        **kwargs
318    ) -> RabbitMQInterface:
319        """
320        Create RabbitMQ interface with connection URL.
321
322        Parameters
323        ----------
324        url : str
325            RabbitMQ connection URL
326        **kwargs
327            Additional configuration options
328
329        Returns
330        -------
331        RabbitMQInterface
332            Configured RabbitMQ interface
333        """
334        config_overrides = {
335            'url': url,
336            **kwargs
337        }
338        return cls.create_interface('rabbitmq', config_overrides=config_overrides)
339
340    @classmethod
341    def create_hil_interface(
342        cls,
343        controller_endpoint: str = "localhost:8080",
344        plant_endpoint: str = "localhost:8081",
345        protocol: str = "udp"
346    ) -> Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol]:
347        """
348        Create Hardware-in-the-Loop interface pair.
349
350        Parameters
351        ----------
352        controller_endpoint : str
353            Controller interface endpoint
354        plant_endpoint : str
355            Plant interface endpoint
356        protocol : str
357            Communication protocol ('udp', 'tcp')
358
359        Returns
360        -------
361        Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol]
362            Dictionary with 'controller' and 'plant' interfaces
363        """
364        if protocol not in ['udp', 'tcp']:
365            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported HIL protocol: {protocol}")
366
367        # Create controller interface (client)
368        controller_config = {
369            'endpoint': controller_endpoint,
370        }
371        controller = cls.create_interface(
372            f"{protocol}_client",
373            name="hil_controller",
374            config_overrides=controller_config
375        )
376
377        # Create plant interface (server)
378        plant_config = {
379            'endpoint': plant_endpoint,
380        }
381        plant = cls.create_interface(
382            f"{protocol}_server",
383            name="hil_plant",
384            config_overrides=plant_config
385        )
386
387        return {
388            'controller': controller,
389            'plant': plant
390        }
391
392    @classmethod
393    def register_interface_type(
394        cls,
395        name: str,
396        interface_class: Type[CommunicationProtocol],
397        default_config: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None
398    ) -> None:
399        """
400        Register new interface type with factory.
401
402        Parameters
403        ----------
404        name : str
405            Name for the interface type
406        interface_class : Type[CommunicationProtocol]
407            Interface class to register
408        default_config : Dict[str, Any], optional
409            Default configuration for the interface type
410        """
411        cls._interface_registry[name] = interface_class
412        if default_config:
413            cls._default_configs[name] = default_config
414
415    @classmethod
416    def get_available_types(cls) -> list:
417        """
418        Get list of available interface types.
419
420        Returns
421        -------
422        list
423            List of registered interface type names
424        """
425        return list(cls._interface_registry.keys())
426
427    @classmethod
428    def get_default_config(cls, interface_type: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
429        """
430        Get default configuration for interface type.
431
432        Parameters
433        ----------
434        interface_type : str
435            Interface type name
436
437        Returns
438        -------
439        Dict[str, Any]
440            Default configuration dictionary
441        """
442        return cls._default_configs.get(interface_type, {}).copy()
443
444    @classmethod
445    def _build_interface_config(
446        cls,
447        interface_type: str,
448        name: str,
449        config_overrides: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None
450    ) -> InterfaceConfig:
451        """
452        Build interface configuration from type and overrides.
453
454        Parameters
455        ----------
456        interface_type : str
457            Type of interface
458        name : str
459            Interface name
460        config_overrides : Dict[str, Any], optional
461            Configuration overrides
462
463        Returns
464        -------
465        InterfaceConfig
466            Built interface configuration
467        """
468        # Start with default configuration
469        base_config = cls.get_default_config(interface_type)
470
471        # Apply overrides
472        if config_overrides:
473            base_config.update(config_overrides)
474
475        # Map interface type to InterfaceType enum
476        interface_type_mapping = {
477            'udp': InterfaceType.UDP,
478            'udp_server': InterfaceType.UDP,
479            'udp_client': InterfaceType.UDP,
480            'tcp': InterfaceType.TCP,
481            'tcp_server': InterfaceType.TCP,
482            'tcp_client': InterfaceType.TCP,
483            'http': InterfaceType.HTTP,
484            'http_server': InterfaceType.HTTP,
485            'http_client': InterfaceType.HTTP,
486            'websocket': InterfaceType.WEBSOCKET,
487            'ws_server': InterfaceType.WEBSOCKET,
488            'ws_client': InterfaceType.WEBSOCKET,
489            'zeromq': InterfaceType.ZEROMQ,
490            'rabbitmq': InterfaceType.MQTT,  # Close enough for enum
491        }
492
493        # Create InterfaceConfig
494        config = InterfaceConfig(
495            name=name,
496            interface_type=interface_type_mapping.get(interface_type, InterfaceType.TCP),
497            description=f"{interface_type} interface",
498            endpoint=base_config.get('endpoint', 'localhost:8080'),
499            timeout=base_config.get('timeout', 30.0),
500            retry_attempts=base_config.get('retry_attempts', 3),
501            retry_delay=base_config.get('retry_delay', 1.0),
502            keep_alive=base_config.get('keep_alive', True),
503            send_buffer_size=base_config.get('send_buffer_size', 8192),
504            receive_buffer_size=base_config.get('receive_buffer_size', 8192),
505            max_message_size=base_config.get('max_message_size', 1024 * 1024),
506            serialization=base_config.get('serialization', 'json'),
507            compression=base_config.get('compression'),
508            encoding=base_config.get('encoding', 'utf-8'),
509            message_ordering=base_config.get('message_ordering', False),
510            duplicate_detection=base_config.get('duplicate_detection', False),
511            delivery_confirmation=base_config.get('delivery_confirmation', False),
512            enable_metrics=base_config.get('enable_metrics', True),
513            enable_logging=base_config.get('enable_logging', True),
514            log_level=base_config.get('log_level', 'INFO')
515        )
516
517        # Set custom settings
518        for key, value in base_config.items():
519            if key not in [
520                'endpoint', 'timeout', 'retry_attempts', 'retry_delay',
521                'keep_alive', 'send_buffer_size', 'receive_buffer_size',
522                'max_message_size', 'serialization', 'compression',
523                'encoding', 'message_ordering', 'duplicate_detection',
524                'delivery_confirmation', 'enable_metrics', 'enable_logging',
525                'log_level'
526            ]:
527                config.set_setting(key, value)
528
529        return config
530
531
532# Convenience functions for common interface creation patterns
533def create_control_communication_pair(
534    protocol: str = "udp",
535    controller_port: int = 8080,
536    plant_port: int = 8081,
537    host: str = "localhost"
538) -> Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol]:
539    """
540    Create communication interface pair for control applications.
541
542    Parameters
543    ----------
544    protocol : str
545        Communication protocol ('udp', 'tcp', 'websocket')
546    controller_port : int
547        Port for controller interface
548    plant_port : int
549        Port for plant interface
550    host : str
551        Host address
552
553    Returns
554    -------
555    Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol]
556        Dictionary with 'controller' and 'plant' interfaces
557    """
558    return NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_hil_interface(
559        controller_endpoint=f"{host}:{controller_port}",
560        plant_endpoint=f"{host}:{plant_port}",
561        protocol=protocol
562    )
563
564
565def create_monitoring_interface(
566    port: int = 8080,
567    host: str = "localhost",
568    interface_type: str = "http"
569) -> CommunicationProtocol:
570    """
571    Create monitoring interface for control system observation.
572
573    Parameters
574    ----------
575    port : int
576        Port number
577    host : str
578        Host address
579    interface_type : str
580        Type of interface ('http', 'websocket')
581
582    Returns
583    -------
584    CommunicationProtocol
585        Configured monitoring interface
586    """
587    if interface_type == "http":
588        return NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_http_interface(
589            host=host, port=port, server_mode=True
590        )
591    elif interface_type == "websocket":
592        return NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_websocket_interface(
593            host=host, port=port, server_mode=True
594        )
595    else:
596        raise ValueError(f"Unsupported monitoring interface type: {interface_type}")
597
598
599def create_distributed_control_mesh(
600    nodes: list,
601    protocol: str = "zeromq"
602) -> Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol]:
603    """
604    Create mesh of communication interfaces for distributed control.
605
606    Parameters
607    ----------
608    nodes : list
609        List of node configurations
610    protocol : str
611        Communication protocol ('zeromq', 'rabbitmq')
612
613    Returns
614    -------
615    Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol]
616        Dictionary of node interfaces
617    """
618    interfaces = {}
619
620    for node_config in nodes:
621        node_name = node_config['name']
622        if protocol == "zeromq":
623            interfaces[node_name] = NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_zeromq_interface(
624                socket_configs=node_config.get('sockets', [])
625            )
626        elif protocol == "rabbitmq":
627            interfaces[node_name] = NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_rabbitmq_interface(
628                url=node_config.get('url', 'amqp://guest:guest@localhost/')
629            )
630        else:
631            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported distributed protocol: {protocol}")
632
633    return interfaces

ClassesÂ¶

NetworkInterfaceFactoryÂ¶

Factory for creating network communication interfaces.

This factory provides centralized creation and configuration of various network interface types with consistent configuration patterns and error handling.

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class NetworkInterfaceFactory:
  2    """
  3    Factory for creating network communication interfaces.
  4
  5    This factory provides centralized creation and configuration of
  6    various network interface types with consistent configuration
  7    patterns and error handling.
  8    """
  9
 10    # Registry of available interface types
 11    _interface_registry: Dict[str, Type[CommunicationProtocol]] = {
 12        # UDP interfaces
 13        'udp': UDPInterface,
 14        'udp_server': UDPServer,
 15        'udp_client': UDPClient,
 16
 17        # TCP interfaces
 18        'tcp': TCPInterface,
 19        'tcp_server': TCPServer,
 20        'tcp_client': TCPClient,
 21
 22        # HTTP interfaces
 23        'http': HTTPInterface,
 24        'http_server': HTTPServer,
 25        'http_client': HTTPClient,
 26
 27        # WebSocket interfaces
 28        'websocket': WebSocketInterface,
 29        'ws_server': WebSocketServer,
 30        'ws_client': WebSocketClient,
 31
 32        # Message queue interfaces
 33        'zeromq': ZeroMQInterface,
 34        'rabbitmq': RabbitMQInterface,
 35    }
 36
 37    # Default configurations for interface types
 38    _default_configs: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]] = {
 39        'udp': {
 40            'endpoint': 'localhost:8080',
 41            'use_crc': True,
 42            'use_sequence': True,
 43            'buffer_size': 4096,
 44        },
 45        'tcp': {
 46            'endpoint': 'localhost:8080',
 47            'auto_reconnect': True,
 48            'reconnect_delay': 5.0,
 49            'max_message_size': 1024 * 1024,
 50        },
 51        'http': {
 52            'endpoint': 'localhost:8080',
 53            'enable_cors': True,
 54            'timeout': 30.0,
 55        },
 56        'websocket': {
 57            'endpoint': 'localhost:8080',
 58            'heartbeat_interval': 30.0,
 59        },
 60        'zeromq': {
 61            'sockets': [
 62                {
 63                    'name': 'pub',
 64                    'type': 'pub',
 65                    'endpoint': 'tcp://localhost:5555',
 66                    'bind': True
 67                }
 68            ]
 69        },
 70        'rabbitmq': {
 71            'url': 'amqp://guest:guest@localhost/',
 72        }
 73    }
 74
 75    @classmethod
 76    def create_interface(
 77        cls,
 78        interface_type: str,
 79        name: str = "default",
 80        config_overrides: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None
 81    ) -> CommunicationProtocol:
 82        """
 83        Create network interface of specified type.
 84
 85        Parameters
 86        ----------
 87        interface_type : str
 88            Type of interface to create (e.g., 'udp', 'tcp_server', 'websocket')
 89        name : str
 90            Name for the interface instance
 91        config_overrides : Dict[str, Any], optional
 92            Configuration overrides for the interface
 93
 94        Returns
 95        -------
 96        CommunicationProtocol
 97            Configured network interface instance
 98
 99        Raises
100        ------
101        ValueError
102            If interface type is not supported
103        """
104        if interface_type not in cls._interface_registry:
105            available_types = list(cls._interface_registry.keys())
106            raise ValueError(
107                f"Unsupported interface type: {interface_type}. "
108                f"Available types: {available_types}"
109            )
110
111        # Get interface class
112        interface_class = cls._interface_registry[interface_type]
113
114        # Build configuration
115        config = cls._build_interface_config(
116            interface_type, name, config_overrides
117        )
118
119        # Create and return interface instance
120        try:
121            return interface_class(config)
122        except Exception as e:
123            logging.error(f"Failed to create {interface_type} interface: {e}")
124            raise
125
126    @classmethod
127    def create_udp_interface(
128        cls,
129        host: str = "localhost",
130        port: int = 8080,
131        server_mode: bool = False,
132        **kwargs
133    ) -> Union[UDPInterface, UDPServer, UDPClient]:
134        """
135        Create UDP interface with simplified configuration.
136
137        Parameters
138        ----------
139        host : str
140            Host address
141        port : int
142            Port number
143        server_mode : bool
144            Whether to create server or client interface
145        **kwargs
146            Additional configuration options
147
148        Returns
149        -------
150        UDPInterface
151            Configured UDP interface
152        """
153        interface_type = 'udp_server' if server_mode else 'udp_client'
154        config_overrides = {
155            'endpoint': f"{host}:{port}",
156            **kwargs
157        }
158        return cls.create_interface(interface_type, config_overrides=config_overrides)
159
160    @classmethod
161    def create_tcp_interface(
162        cls,
163        host: str = "localhost",
164        port: int = 8080,
165        server_mode: bool = False,
166        **kwargs
167    ) -> Union[TCPInterface, TCPServer, TCPClient]:
168        """
169        Create TCP interface with simplified configuration.
170
171        Parameters
172        ----------
173        host : str
174            Host address
175        port : int
176            Port number
177        server_mode : bool
178            Whether to create server or client interface
179        **kwargs
180            Additional configuration options
181
182        Returns
183        -------
184        TCPInterface
185            Configured TCP interface
186        """
187        interface_type = 'tcp_server' if server_mode else 'tcp_client'
188        config_overrides = {
189            'endpoint': f"{host}:{port}",
190            **kwargs
191        }
192        return cls.create_interface(interface_type, config_overrides=config_overrides)
193
194    @classmethod
195    def create_http_interface(
196        cls,
197        host: str = "localhost",
198        port: int = 8080,
199        server_mode: bool = False,
200        **kwargs
201    ) -> Union[HTTPInterface, HTTPServer, HTTPClient]:
202        """
203        Create HTTP interface with simplified configuration.
204
205        Parameters
206        ----------
207        host : str
208            Host address
209        port : int
210            Port number
211        server_mode : bool
212            Whether to create server or client interface
213        **kwargs
214            Additional configuration options
215
216        Returns
217        -------
218        HTTPInterface
219            Configured HTTP interface
220        """
221        interface_type = 'http_server' if server_mode else 'http_client'
222        config_overrides = {
223            'endpoint': f"http://{host}:{port}",
224            **kwargs
225        }
226        return cls.create_interface(interface_type, config_overrides=config_overrides)
227
228    @classmethod
229    def create_websocket_interface(
230        cls,
231        host: str = "localhost",
232        port: int = 8080,
233        server_mode: bool = False,
234        **kwargs
235    ) -> Union[WebSocketInterface, WebSocketServer, WebSocketClient]:
236        """
237        Create WebSocket interface with simplified configuration.
238
239        Parameters
240        ----------
241        host : str
242            Host address
243        port : int
244            Port number
245        server_mode : bool
246            Whether to create server or client interface
247        **kwargs
248            Additional configuration options
249
250        Returns
251        -------
252        WebSocketInterface
253            Configured WebSocket interface
254        """
255        interface_type = 'ws_server' if server_mode else 'ws_client'
256        config_overrides = {
257            'endpoint': f"ws://{host}:{port}",
258            **kwargs
259        }
260        return cls.create_interface(interface_type, config_overrides=config_overrides)
261
262    @classmethod
263    def create_zeromq_interface(
264        cls,
265        socket_configs: Optional[list] = None,
266        **kwargs
267    ) -> ZeroMQInterface:
268        """
269        Create ZeroMQ interface with socket configuration.
270
271        Parameters
272        ----------
273        socket_configs : list, optional
274            List of socket configurations
275        **kwargs
276            Additional configuration options
277
278        Returns
279        -------
280        ZeroMQInterface
281            Configured ZeroMQ interface
282        """
283        config_overrides = kwargs.copy()
284        if socket_configs:
285            config_overrides['sockets'] = socket_configs
286
287        return cls.create_interface('zeromq', config_overrides=config_overrides)
288
289    @classmethod
290    def create_rabbitmq_interface(
291        cls,
292        url: str = "amqp://guest:guest@localhost/",
293        **kwargs
294    ) -> RabbitMQInterface:
295        """
296        Create RabbitMQ interface with connection URL.
297
298        Parameters
299        ----------
300        url : str
301            RabbitMQ connection URL
302        **kwargs
303            Additional configuration options
304
305        Returns
306        -------
307        RabbitMQInterface
308            Configured RabbitMQ interface
309        """
310        config_overrides = {
311            'url': url,
312            **kwargs
313        }
314        return cls.create_interface('rabbitmq', config_overrides=config_overrides)
315
316    @classmethod
317    def create_hil_interface(
318        cls,
319        controller_endpoint: str = "localhost:8080",
320        plant_endpoint: str = "localhost:8081",
321        protocol: str = "udp"
322    ) -> Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol]:
323        """
324        Create Hardware-in-the-Loop interface pair.
325
326        Parameters
327        ----------
328        controller_endpoint : str
329            Controller interface endpoint
330        plant_endpoint : str
331            Plant interface endpoint
332        protocol : str
333            Communication protocol ('udp', 'tcp')
334
335        Returns
336        -------
337        Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol]
338            Dictionary with 'controller' and 'plant' interfaces
339        """
340        if protocol not in ['udp', 'tcp']:
341            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported HIL protocol: {protocol}")
342
343        # Create controller interface (client)
344        controller_config = {
345            'endpoint': controller_endpoint,
346        }
347        controller = cls.create_interface(
348            f"{protocol}_client",
349            name="hil_controller",
350            config_overrides=controller_config
351        )
352
353        # Create plant interface (server)
354        plant_config = {
355            'endpoint': plant_endpoint,
356        }
357        plant = cls.create_interface(
358            f"{protocol}_server",
359            name="hil_plant",
360            config_overrides=plant_config
361        )
362
363        return {
364            'controller': controller,
365            'plant': plant
366        }
367
368    @classmethod
369    def register_interface_type(
370        cls,
371        name: str,
372        interface_class: Type[CommunicationProtocol],
373        default_config: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None
374    ) -> None:
375        """
376        Register new interface type with factory.
377
378        Parameters
379        ----------
380        name : str
381            Name for the interface type
382        interface_class : Type[CommunicationProtocol]
383            Interface class to register
384        default_config : Dict[str, Any], optional
385            Default configuration for the interface type
386        """
387        cls._interface_registry[name] = interface_class
388        if default_config:
389            cls._default_configs[name] = default_config
390
391    @classmethod
392    def get_available_types(cls) -> list:
393        """
394        Get list of available interface types.
395
396        Returns
397        -------
398        list
399            List of registered interface type names
400        """
401        return list(cls._interface_registry.keys())
402
403    @classmethod
404    def get_default_config(cls, interface_type: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
405        """
406        Get default configuration for interface type.
407
408        Parameters
409        ----------
410        interface_type : str
411            Interface type name
412
413        Returns
414        -------
415        Dict[str, Any]
416            Default configuration dictionary
417        """
418        return cls._default_configs.get(interface_type, {}).copy()
419
420    @classmethod
421    def _build_interface_config(
422        cls,
423        interface_type: str,
424        name: str,
425        config_overrides: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None
426    ) -> InterfaceConfig:
427        """
428        Build interface configuration from type and overrides.
429
430        Parameters
431        ----------
432        interface_type : str
433            Type of interface
434        name : str
435            Interface name
436        config_overrides : Dict[str, Any], optional
437            Configuration overrides
438
439        Returns
440        -------
441        InterfaceConfig
442            Built interface configuration
443        """
444        # Start with default configuration
445        base_config = cls.get_default_config(interface_type)
446
447        # Apply overrides
448        if config_overrides:
449            base_config.update(config_overrides)
450
451        # Map interface type to InterfaceType enum
452        interface_type_mapping = {
453            'udp': InterfaceType.UDP,
454            'udp_server': InterfaceType.UDP,
455            'udp_client': InterfaceType.UDP,
456            'tcp': InterfaceType.TCP,
457            'tcp_server': InterfaceType.TCP,
458            'tcp_client': InterfaceType.TCP,
459            'http': InterfaceType.HTTP,
460            'http_server': InterfaceType.HTTP,
461            'http_client': InterfaceType.HTTP,
462            'websocket': InterfaceType.WEBSOCKET,
463            'ws_server': InterfaceType.WEBSOCKET,
464            'ws_client': InterfaceType.WEBSOCKET,
465            'zeromq': InterfaceType.ZEROMQ,
466            'rabbitmq': InterfaceType.MQTT,  # Close enough for enum
467        }
468
469        # Create InterfaceConfig
470        config = InterfaceConfig(
471            name=name,
472            interface_type=interface_type_mapping.get(interface_type, InterfaceType.TCP),
473            description=f"{interface_type} interface",
474            endpoint=base_config.get('endpoint', 'localhost:8080'),
475            timeout=base_config.get('timeout', 30.0),
476            retry_attempts=base_config.get('retry_attempts', 3),
477            retry_delay=base_config.get('retry_delay', 1.0),
478            keep_alive=base_config.get('keep_alive', True),
479            send_buffer_size=base_config.get('send_buffer_size', 8192),
480            receive_buffer_size=base_config.get('receive_buffer_size', 8192),
481            max_message_size=base_config.get('max_message_size', 1024 * 1024),
482            serialization=base_config.get('serialization', 'json'),
483            compression=base_config.get('compression'),
484            encoding=base_config.get('encoding', 'utf-8'),
485            message_ordering=base_config.get('message_ordering', False),
486            duplicate_detection=base_config.get('duplicate_detection', False),
487            delivery_confirmation=base_config.get('delivery_confirmation', False),
488            enable_metrics=base_config.get('enable_metrics', True),
489            enable_logging=base_config.get('enable_logging', True),
490            log_level=base_config.get('log_level', 'INFO')
491        )
492
493        # Set custom settings
494        for key, value in base_config.items():
495            if key not in [
496                'endpoint', 'timeout', 'retry_attempts', 'retry_delay',
497                'keep_alive', 'send_buffer_size', 'receive_buffer_size',
498                'max_message_size', 'serialization', 'compression',
499                'encoding', 'message_ordering', 'duplicate_detection',
500                'delivery_confirmation', 'enable_metrics', 'enable_logging',
501                'log_level'
502            ]:
503                config.set_setting(key, value)
504
505        return config

create_monitoring_interface(port, host, interface_type)Â¶

Create monitoring interface for control system observation.

ParametersÂ¶

port : int Port number host : str Host address interface_type : str Type of interface (â€˜httpâ€™, â€˜websocketâ€™)

ReturnsÂ¶

CommunicationProtocol Configured monitoring interface

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def create_monitoring_interface(
 2    port: int = 8080,
 3    host: str = "localhost",
 4    interface_type: str = "http"
 5) -> CommunicationProtocol:
 6    """
 7    Create monitoring interface for control system observation.
 8
 9    Parameters
10    ----------
11    port : int
12        Port number
13    host : str
14        Host address
15    interface_type : str
16        Type of interface ('http', 'websocket')
17
18    Returns
19    -------
20    CommunicationProtocol
21        Configured monitoring interface
22    """
23    if interface_type == "http":
24        return NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_http_interface(
25            host=host, port=port, server_mode=True
26        )
27    elif interface_type == "websocket":
28        return NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_websocket_interface(
29            host=host, port=port, server_mode=True
30        )
31    else:
32        raise ValueError(f"Unsupported monitoring interface type: {interface_type}")

create_distributed_control_mesh(nodes, protocol)Â¶

Create mesh of communication interfaces for distributed control.

ParametersÂ¶

nodes : list List of node configurations protocol : str Communication protocol (â€˜zeromqâ€™, â€˜rabbitmqâ€™)

ReturnsÂ¶

Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol] Dictionary of node interfaces

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def create_distributed_control_mesh(
 2    nodes: list,
 3    protocol: str = "zeromq"
 4) -> Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol]:
 5    """
 6    Create mesh of communication interfaces for distributed control.
 7
 8    Parameters
 9    ----------
10    nodes : list
11        List of node configurations
12    protocol : str
13        Communication protocol ('zeromq', 'rabbitmq')
14
15    Returns
16    -------
17    Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol]
18        Dictionary of node interfaces
19    """
20    interfaces = {}
21
22    for node_config in nodes:
23        node_name = node_config['name']
24        if protocol == "zeromq":
25            interfaces[node_name] = NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_zeromq_interface(
26                socket_configs=node_config.get('sockets', [])
27            )
28        elif protocol == "rabbitmq":
29            interfaces[node_name] = NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_rabbitmq_interface(
30                url=node_config.get('url', 'amqp://guest:guest@localhost/')
31            )
32        else:
33            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported distributed protocol: {protocol}")
34
35    return interfaces
